text: so who doesn't want a better but now
we've got all these squat challenges
that are surfacing don't get me wrong I
love squats from a standpoint of getting
somebody a better but the problem though
is with some of these challenges they
don't emphasize form so if you're doing
the squat wrong you might not be helping
yourself at all and just doing rep after
rep after rep doesn't really maximize
what you're trying to accomplish so how
do you get a better butt first of all
you have to know how the anatomy really
works and what the hip really does and
so you need extension in the hip to
really activate the glutes so everything
from squats to hip thrusts and even
things involving the hamstrings like
curls Romanian deadlifts and hyper
extensions all of these things engage
the glutes and that's an important part
of this so what's the proper way to do a
squat foot position might vary a little
bit but as a general starting point feet
about shoulder width apart is a good
idea I see a lot of people trying to do
squats with way too narrow of a stance
so in a proper squat you're trying to
keep your head up trying to keep your
spine aligned and think about it like
you're trying to sit down in a chair you
don't want to lean way forward and you
definitely don't want to lean way back
you're trying to lower your thighs
towards the floor to the point that
they're about parallel with it one of
the things that I see a lot of people
make a huge mistake with is they take
way too wide of a grip on the bar when
you do that you tend to pitch forward at
the bottom of the squat so now you're
putting a lot of stress on your lower
back move those hands in a little bit
the other thing too is make sure your
knees and your hips both extend at the
same time what a lot of people will do
is start to straighten out their knees
first and then the butt follows and what
happens is you've already started
leaning over with your upper body before
you ever get the bar to come straight up
if you're building that muscle up which
requires resistance that's what's going
to really shape into find the button and
here's the thing if you really want a
better but sometimes it's important to
lose the layer of fat that's over the
muscle as well so really you kind of
need both
